result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Dekraai was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2_ years bifurcated sentence.

**After service of 2 years of IC, defendant may participate in CIP or SAP.**
Concurrent with: Counts 1 & 6 in 15CF1788.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with victims.  Engage in health programming, personally or professionally designed.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including psychological evaluation, anger management class, and batterers intervention programming. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims in 15CF64, 15CF1788 and 16CF848, A.M. and L.G. (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report between July 25 to 29, 2016 between the hours of 8 AM and 4 PM to the 1st Floor Conference Room in the Racine County Courthouse, 730 Wisconsin Ave. Racine WI 53403 or call 262-638-6448 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report on July 21 or July 22, 2016 from 8am to 4pm. to the 1st Floor Conference Room in the Racine County Courthouse, 730 Wisconsin Ave. Racine WI 53403 or call 262-638-6448 to immediately schedule an appointment.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitoring by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340, in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator).   NOTE: A $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

Defendant Michael R Dekraai in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Michael R Dekraai in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State asks for a new date on 15CF1788. These cases were taken over by Mr. Jensen and until late yesterday, Mr. Jensen was slotted to begin a trial in another court today. Next week's trial is the same situation. Mr. Jensen indicates a global offer was extended on February 24, 2017 and has been rejected. The defendant is serving a sentence so the defendant's liberty is not an issue. Defense objects to the adjournment and asks that the case either be tried or dismissed and indicates that that is their opinion about next week's trial matter as well.

BTC: Trial in 15CF1788 is granted as is the adj request in 16CF848. Bonds in these two cases are to be modified to remove GPS monitor condition from these bonds. The no contact provision is absolutely in effect.
